column4: Am I asking such weird questions? I've been asking the same question for 2 days and nobody has replied yet.
what is your problem
many reasons
what hardware is this on ?
Gnea, I've installed ubuntu before on this machine. many times before. I've tried 2 hard drives, one fresh from the box.
what hardware is this on
acer extensa 5220, 1GB ram, dual core processor.
oh and 320GB hd and 80GB hd. (tried both) it's a laptop.
what happens when you try to install the desktop ?
said it at [14:21]: I tried server, desktop, and netbook. same result everywhere.
you have no mount point
sorry - not you
what happens when you try to install the desktop
I just answered that question :p
what is the problem when you try to install the desktop version
I already said that, three times so far. :S
this is why you are not getting help - I'm asking you to explain what happens when you install the desktop version
instead of saying "I've said" tell me, as I obviously didn't see it, or you didn't explain it clearly
2nd coloumn "none" needs to be a mount point
sorry - not you
I answered this question three times already. I'll paste the answer again:

[14:21] <Solow> I'll rephrase my question... Is there any reason why all ubuntu installations would fail? ubuntu server is stuck at 45% when starting the partitioner. ubuntu netbook and desktop freeze right after 'preparing ubuntu installation' (where you get to select 'download updates while installing').
